metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11576 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FontForge 20161012 does not ensure a positive size in a weight vector memcpy call in readcfftopdict (parsettf.c) resulting in DoS via a crafted otf file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11576` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fontforge - 1:20170731~dfsg-1
fontforge-common - 1:20170731~dfsg-1
fontforge-nox - 1:20170731~dfsg-1
libfontforge2 - 1:20170731~dfsg-1
libgdraw5 - 1:20170731~dfsg-1
python-fontforge - 1:20170731~dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fontforge package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:20170731~dfsg-1').
